32#include <sys/cdefs.h>
33__KERNEL_RCSID(0, "$NetBSD: linux_rcu.c,v 1.4 2018/08/27 15:07:59 riastradh Exp $");
34
35#include <sys/types.h>
36#include <sys/condvar.h>
37#include <sys/cpu.h>
38#include <sys/kthread.h>
39#include <sys/mutex.h>
40#include <sys/sdt.h>
41#include <sys/xcall.h>
42
43#include <linux/rcupdate.h>
44
45SDT_PROBE_DEFINE0(sdt, linux, rcu, synchronize__start);
46SDT_PROBE_DEFINE1(sdt, linux, rcu, synchronize__cpu, "unsigned"/*cpu*/);
47SDT_PROBE_DEFINE0(sdt, linux, rcu, synchronize__done);
48SDT_PROBE_DEFINE2(sdt, linux, rcu, call__queue,
49 "struct rcu_head *"/*head*/, "void (*)(struct rcu_head *)"/*callback*/);
50SDT_PROBE_DEFINE2(sdt, linux, rcu, call__run,
51 "struct rcu_head *"/*head*/, "void (*)(struct rcu_head *)"/*callback*/);
52SDT_PROBE_DEFINE2(sdt, linux, rcu, call__done,
53 "struct rcu_head *"/*head*/, "void (*)(struct rcu_head *)"/*callback*/);
54
55static struct {
56 kmutex_t lock;
57 kcondvar_t cv;
58 struct rcu_head *first;
59 struct lwp *lwp;
60 bool dying;
61} gc __cacheline_aligned;
62
63static void
64synchronize_rcu_xc(void *a, void *b)
65{
66
67 SDT_PROBE1(sdt, linux, rcu, synchronize__cpu, cpu_index(curcpu()));
68}
69
70void
71synchronize_rcu(void)
72{
73
74 SDT_PROBE0(sdt, linux, rcu, synchronize__start);
75 xc_wait(xc_broadcast(0, &synchronize_rcu_xc, NULL, NULL));
76 SDT_PROBE0(sdt, linux, rcu, synchronize__done);
77}
78
79void
80call_rcu(struct rcu_head *head, void (*callback)(struct rcu_head *))
81{
82
83 head->rcuh_callback = callback;
84
85 mutex_enter(&gc.lock);
86 head->rcuh_next = gc.first;
87 gc.first = head;
88 cv_signal(&gc.cv);
89 SDT_PROBE2(sdt, linux, rcu, call__queue, head, callback);
90 mutex_exit(&gc.lock);
91}
92
93static void
94gc_thread(void *cookie)
95{
96 struct rcu_head *head, *next;
97 void (*callback)(struct rcu_head *);
98
99 mutex_enter(&gc.lock);
100 for (;;) {
101 /* Wait for a task or death notice. */
102 while ((head = gc.first) == NULL && !gc.dying)
103 cv_wait(&gc.cv, &gc.lock);
104
105 /* If we got a list of callbacks, run them. */
106 if (head != NULL) {
107 gc.first = NULL; /* mine */
108 mutex_exit(&gc.lock);
109
110 /* Wait for activity on all CPUs. */
111 synchronize_rcu();
112
113 /* It is now safe to call the callbacks. */
114 for (; head != NULL; head = next) {
115 next = head->rcuh_next;
116 callback = head->rcuh_callback;
117 SDT_PROBE2(sdt, linux, rcu, call__run,
118 head, callback);
119 (*callback)(head);
120 /*
121 * Can't dereference head or invoke
122 * callback after this point.
123 */
124 SDT_PROBE2(sdt, linux, rcu, call__done,
125 head, callback);
126 }
127
128 mutex_enter(&gc.lock);
129 }
130
131 /* If we're asked to close shop, do so. */
132 if (gc.dying)
133 break;
134 }
135 mutex_exit(&gc.lock);
136
137 kthread_exit(0);
138}
139
140int
141linux_rcu_gc_init(void)
142{
143 int error;
144
145 mutex_init(&gc.lock, MUTEX_DEFAULT, IPL_VM);
146 cv_init(&gc.cv, "lnxrcugc");
147 gc.first = NULL;
148 gc.dying = false;
149
150 error = kthread_create(PRI_NONE,
151 KTHREAD_MPSAFE|KTHREAD_TS|KTHREAD_MUSTJOIN, NULL, &gc_thread, NULL,
152 &gc.lwp, "lnxrcugc");
153 if (error)
154 goto fail;
155
156 /* Success! */
157 return 0;
158
159fail: cv_destroy(&gc.cv);
160 mutex_destroy(&gc.lock);
161 return error;
162}
163
164void
165linux_rcu_gc_fini(void)
166{
167
168 mutex_enter(&gc.lock);
169 gc.dying = true;
170 cv_signal(&gc.cv);
171 mutex_exit(&gc.lock);
172
173 kthread_join(gc.lwp);
174 gc.lwp = NULL;
175 KASSERT(gc.first == NULL);
176 cv_destroy(&gc.cv);
177 mutex_destroy(&gc.lock);
178}
